name: Lanhydrock Great Wood and Beech Avenue walk, Lanhydrock

ai.summary: The Lanhydrock Great Wood and Beech Avenue walk is a 7.4 km woodland circuit near Lanhydrock, Cornwall. It combines shaded forest trails through the Great Wood with a picturesque Beech Avenue, offering a moderate workout and peaceful scenery for walkers of most levels.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-marked forest paths and gravel tracks, with some sections of dirt and exposed tree roots. Gentle to moderate climbs, particularly on approaches to the Beech Avenue. Expect occasional muddy patches after rain and shade throughout the route.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before you go; paths can be slippery when wet. Stay on marked routes and watch for roots, rocks and uneven ground. Mobile reception can be limited in wooded areas, so carry a map or offline navigation. Ticks and other wildlife are common in UK woodlands; wear long trousers and use insect repellent. Keep dogs under control and on a lead where required; carry enough water and a small first aid kit for minor injuries. Dress in layers and be prepared to adjust for changing conditions.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good grip
Layered clothing and a waterproof jacket
Map or offline GPS and a fully charged phone
Lightweight pack rain cover or packable rain gear
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn are ideal for color and comfortable temperatures; summer offers longer daylight for a relaxed pace; winter hikes are possible but can be cold, wet, and muddy with shorter daylight.
